title: Reddit - The heart of the internet
text: Does Microsoft Copilot Pro deliver higher quality outputs vs the free version? TL;DR: Does the paid version of Microsoft Copilot provide higher-quality responses overall compared to the free version, beyond just extra features? Seeking insights from users of both versions to help decide if the $20/month is worth it for my general use cases. Microsoft offers both a free version of Copilot as well as a paid Copilot Pro subscription for $20/month. The Pro version unlocks additional features like Copilot GPT Builder for custom chatbots and higher resolution image creation. However, I'm wondering if upgrading to the paid Copilot Pro would also provide better quality and more insightful responses overall. My question is a general one, but to give some context, a few potential use cases for me include career advice, resume tailoring, cover letter brainstorming, practical advice, and relationship/family advice. These are just examples, I'm primarily interested in whether the paid version delivers higher-quality outputs in general across use cases. If you have used both the free and paid versions, have you noticed the paid Copilot being smarter, more accurate, and giving higher quality answers in general? Or is the main difference just the extra capabilities? I'm trying to decide if it's worth the $20/month for my needs, so I'd appreciate any insights from Copilot Pro users on the differences in response quality between the free and paid versions. Thanks in advance for all your responses.
